content: Which means, President Barack Obama will be making his first Supreme Court appointment. His critics, not always of the soundest mind, probably think he'll either appoint Reverend Wright or Bill Ayers but no matter who he appoints, I imagine his first choice will be somewhat better than Harriet Miers. In any case, it's a historic choice with long reaching implications for the court. Thoughts, opinions? Predictions?
reply: Which means, President Barack Obama will be making his first Supreme Court appointment. His critics, not always of the soundest mind, probably think he'll either appoint Reverend Wright or Bill Ayers but no matter who he appoints, I imagine his first choice will be somewhat better than Harriet Miers. In any case, it's a historic choice with long reaching implications for the court. Thoughts, opinions? Predictions?
title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

content: in many ways souter was the voice of reason on the SCOTUS. he was usually the one who would make or break a decision. and when he did it was usually based on law and not ideology. he kept the court from being one sided and itll be sad to see that end. IMO anyway.
reply: in many ways souter was the voice of reason on the SCOTUS. he was usually the one who would make or break a decision. and when he did it was usually based on law and not ideology. he kept the court from being one sided and itll be sad to see that end. IMO anyway.
title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

content: He, Souter, already votes mostly liberal, but the next appointee, certainly to be rubber-stamped by the Democrat-controlled Senate, could be an ultra-liberal with a huge agenda in his or her pocket... Jesse Jackson? Al Sharpton?? Hillary or Bill Clinton??? Don't forget that former President William Howard Taft finished up his career as a Supreme Court Justice... I guess Governor Braggadociodavich can't be on the list, but what about about the well-respected fellow social activist and community organizer William Ayers? Obama could also pick his own wife and keep it in the family, since she is probably the power generator anyway - - It will be interesting to see how this all plays out, but the "Checks and Balances" supposedly guaranteed by the Constitution could be seeing their last glimpses of day - - Wandering and Wondering

title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: He, Souter, already votes mostly liberal, but the next appointee, certainly to be rubber-stamped by the Democrat-controlled Senate, could be an ultra-liberal with a huge agenda in his or her pocket... Jesse Jackson? Al Sharpton?? Hillary or Bill Clinton??? Don't forget that former President William Howard Taft finished up his career as a Supreme Court Justice... I guess Governor Braggadociodavich can't be on the list, but what about about the well-respected fellow social activist and community organizer William Ayers? Obama could also pick his own wife and keep it in the family, since she is probably the power generator anyway - - It will be interesting to see how this all plays out, but the "Checks and Balances" supposedly guaranteed by the Constitution could be seeing their last glimpses of day - - No. He'll pick a respected jurist, someone qualified for the position. None of the people you mentioned are qualified for the Supreme Court, the only government branch with an expectation of academic and professional excellence. Bush really screwed up thinking that Congress and the US would accept a nominee like Harriet Miers, and Obama is too smart to repeat his mistake. Thomas will be last under-qualified person to actually reach the bench for a while. Alito and Breyer were okay, Roberts and Ginsberg were excellent (don't remember the other confirmation hearings). Professionally, that is - it is hard to predict what they will do when they reach the SCOTUS. Scalia became downright nutty.
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: He, Souter, already votes mostly liberal, but the next appointee, certainly to be rubber-stamped by the Democrat-controlled Senate, could be an ultra-liberal with a huge agenda in his or her pocket... Obama could also pick his own wife and keep it in the family, since she is probably the power generator anyway - - It will be interesting to see how this all plays out, but the "Checks and Balances" supposedly guaranteed by the Constitution could be seeing their last glimpses of day - -
reply: No. He'll pick a respected jurist, someone qualified for the position. None of the people you mentioned are qualified for the Supreme Court, the only government branch with an expectation of academic and professional excellence. Bush really screwed up thinking that Congress and the US would accept a nominee like Harriet Miers, and Obama is too smart to repeat his mistake. Thomas will be last under-qualified person to actually reach the bench for a while. Alito and Breyer were okay, Roberts and Ginsberg were excellent (don't remember the other confirmation hearings). Professionally, that is - it is hard to predict what they will do when they reach the SCOTUS. Scalia became downright nutty.

title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

content: quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: Supreme Court justices do not have to be lawyers, he could appoint anyone he desires, if they can clear the Senate hearings, all they would have to be is democrat, lefty liberal and kowtow to the party line/ True, and he could also nominate some homeless guy with a 3rd grade education he got off the street, but that doesn't mean he would, or that the Senate would back him up! They have to get reelected too, so the person has to be at least slightly qualified or they will eat it the following election. Heck, Bush had the Senate but could not get Miers through. Look at Obama's other appointments: it will be someone who at least on paper is very well qualified. It will be someone with distinct liberal bona fides, probably a female, a hispanic, or a female hispanic. The big question is going to be what they're REALLY like after they are confirmed - there have been a number of Justices who "switched teams" once they were on the SCOTUS.
quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: Supreme Court justices do not have to be lawyers, he could appoint anyone he desires, if they can clear the Senate hearings, all they would have to be is democrat, lefty liberal and kowtow to the party line/
reply: True, and he could also nominate some homeless guy with a 3rd grade education he got off the street, but that doesn't mean he would, or that the Senate would back him up! They have to get reelected too, so the person has to be at least slightly qualified or they will eat it the following election. Heck, Bush had the Senate but could not get Miers through. Look at Obama's other appointments: it will be someone who at least on paper is very well qualified. It will be someone with distinct liberal bona fides, probably a female, a hispanic, or a female hispanic. The big question is going to be what they're REALLY like after they are confirmed - there have been a number of Justices who "switched teams" once they were on the SCOTUS.

Obama could also pick his own wife and keep it in the family, since she is probably the power generator anyway - - It will be interesting to see how this all plays out, but the "Checks and Balances" supposedly guaranteed by the Constitution could be seeing their last glimpses of day - - No. He'll pick a respected jurist, someone qualified for the position. None of the people you mentioned are qualified for the Supreme Court, the only government branch with an expectation of academic and professional excellence. Bush really screwed up thinking that Congress and the US would accept a nominee like Harriet Miers, and Obama is too smart to repeat his mistake. Thomas will be last under-qualified person to actually reach the bench for a while. Alito and Breyer were okay, Roberts and Ginsberg were excellent (don't remember the other confirmation hearings). Professionally, that is - it is hard to predict what they will do when they reach the SCOTUS. Scalia became downright nutty.
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: He, Souter, already votes mostly liberal, but the next appointee, certainly to be rubber-stamped by the Democrat-controlled Senate, could be an ultra-liberal with a huge agenda in his or her pocket... Jesse Jackson? Al Sharpton?? Hillary or Bill Clinton??? Don't forget that former President William Howard Taft finished up his career as a Supreme Court Justice... I guess Governor Braggadociodavich can't be on the list, but what about about the well-respected fellow social activist and community organizer William Ayers? Obama could also pick his own wife and keep it in the family, since she is probably the power generator anyway - - It will be interesting to see how this all plays out, but the "Checks and Balances" supposedly guaranteed by the Constitution could be seeing their last glimpses of day - -
reply: No. He'll pick a respected jurist, someone qualified for the position. None of the people you mentioned are qualified for the Supreme Court, the only government branch with an expectation of academic and professional excellence. Bush really screwed up thinking that Congress and the US would accept a nominee like Harriet Miers, and Obama is too smart to repeat his mistake. Thomas will be last under-qualified person to actually reach the bench for a while. Alito and Breyer were okay, Roberts and Ginsberg were excellent (don't remember the other confirmation hearings). Professionally, that is - it is hard to predict what they will do when they reach the SCOTUS. Scalia became downright nutty.
title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

title: Justice Souter to retire from the Supreme Court.

content: quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: Supreme Court justices do not have to be lawyers, he could appoint anyone he desires, if they can clear the Senate hearings, all they would have to be is democrat, lefty liberal and kowtow to the party line/ True, and he could also nominate some homeless guy with a 3rd grade education he got off the street, but that doesn't mean he would, or that the Senate would back him up! They have to get reelected too, so the person has to be at least slightly qualified or they will eat it the following election. Heck, Bush had the Senate but could not get Miers through. Look at Obama's other appointments: it will be someone who at least on paper is very well qualified. It will be someone with distinct liberal bona fides, probably a female, a hispanic, or a female hispanic. The big question is going to be what they're REALLY like after they are confirmed - there have been a number of Justices who "switched teams" once they were on the SCOTUS.
quote: Originally posted by OldDoc: Supreme Court justices do not have to be lawyers, he could appoint anyone he desires, if they can clear the Senate hearings, all they would have to be is democrat, lefty liberal and kowtow to the party line/
reply: True, and he could also nominate some homeless guy with a 3rd grade education he got off the street, but that doesn't mean he would, or that the Senate would back him up! They have to get reelected too, so the person has to be at least slightly qualified or they will eat it the following election. Heck, Bush had the Senate but could not get Miers through. Look at Obama's other appointments: it will be someone who at least on paper is very well qualified. It will be someone with distinct liberal bona fides, probably a female, a hispanic, or a female hispanic. The big question is going to be what they're REALLY like after they are confirmed - there have been a number of Justices who "switched teams" once they were on the SCOTUS.
